intro: Enneastemon angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed enneastemon, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, blooming in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural areas.
